OOC: Don't sweat it, hey, we've all been there and
been on a roll- I think the best way any RPer can
approach freeform posting is to ask themselves if
every player involved in that scene has had a fair
chance to reply. If the answer is yes, post til the
answer is no :).

 --- shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@...>
wrote: 
---------------------------------
OOC:
You are quite right, of course. I'm trying to reply to
too much. I 
shall not post so much so others can post as well.
Thank you for 
pointing out my rpg flaw. I appreciate it. 
Any suggestions on playing better is always
appreciated. 



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Polar Claw
<cycodrone@y...> wrote:
> Speaking of Moding shadowess, your posting rate
could
> also be considered moding considering it denies
> players on the other side of the world like myself a
> fair chance of reply, and to be brutally honest-
it's
> really starting to piss me off. True that you're not
> the only offender of this, but you're one of the
worst
> if not the worst- I'm starting to lose track of the
> number of times I haven't had a fair crack at
repling
> at because the situation has been moved too far
> forward for a fair reply. Could you please be more
> considerate of other players in the future?
> 
>  --- robert riley <bustercross365@y...> wrote: >
> OOC- Sorry!  I refrain from doing that again.
> >

transform

do

she

> >

it

he
